meanings.definition: Superlative form of sick, meaning very ill or unwell.
meanings.sent1: After eating expired food, I felt the sickest I have ever felt.
meanings.sent2: My friend looked the sickest when he had a high fever.
meanings.sent3: The spoiled milk smelled the sickest, making me gag.
meanings.sent4: The flu hit me like a ton of bricks, leaving me feeling the sickest I've ever been.
meanings.sent5: The doctor said I was the sickest patient she had seen all week.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of sick, meaning extremely cool or impressive.
meanings.sent1: The new video game console is the sickest thing I've ever seen!
meanings.sent2: His skateboard tricks are the sickest in the whole skate park.
meanings.sent3: The sickest car in the neighborhood turned heads as it drove by.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were the sickest on the dance floor, impressing everyone.
meanings.sent5: The sickest guitar solo brought the crowd to their feet in applause.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of sick, meaning disgusting or revolting.
meanings.sent1: The smell from the garbage can was the sickest thing I've ever encountered.
meanings.sent2: The moldy sandwich in the fridge looked the sickest out of all the leftovers.
meanings.sent3: The slimy texture of the food was the sickest part of the meal.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie had the sickest scenes that made me cover my eyes.
meanings.sent5: The public restroom was the sickest place I've ever had to use.
